commitResults.messageTitle: Rename chatbot from Duke to Sora
commitResults.messageBody: Change the name of the chatbot from Duke to Sora and remove all references to Duke where applicable to ensure consistency.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor ASCII logo into text block
commitResults.messageBody:
Previous logo used concatenated strings with \n, which was messy and difficult to edit.

Refactor the ASCII-art logo into a Java text block to improve readability of the logo representation.

commitResults.messageTitle: Ui class: Add private printLine() method
commitResults.messageBody:
UI output lack clear visual separation between messages, making it difficult to read.

Add a private helper method that prints a horizontal divider before and after each message to improve readability and consistency.

Chatbot does not greet user when the program starts.

Add a greetUser() method to greet the user when the program starts to provide a friendly interface at launch.

Chatbot currently does not provide a closing message, making the program feel abrupt at exit.

Add a farewellMessage() method to display the farewell message the user before the program exit to provide a friendly interface upon exit.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add preceding line before farewell message
commitResults.messageBody:
Farewell message was only separated by a single divider after the message was printed, making the console feels unbalanced.

Add another horizontal divider before the farewell message to create a consistent visual separation.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add CommandHandler class to manage workflow
commitResults.messageBody:
Introduce CommandHandler class to encapsulate user interaction logic and streamline the workflow.

Provides a run() method that serves as a central entry point for command handling. This refactoring improves code organization and prepares the program from handling future extensions.
Include a Javadoc comment for the CommandHandler class to explain its role in managing user interactions.
Add echo() method that prints a user command.

The run() method previously did not support interactive user input and contained limited workflow logic.

Extend run() to read user commands in a loop and introduce a private helper method handleCommand() to improve readability, structure, and make the command handling logic easier to extend in the future.

commitResults.messageTitle: Store tasks and display confirmation message
commitResults.messageBody: Save each user-entered task into an array. After adding a task, a confirmation message will be displayed to let user know it has been successfully added, to provide a more user-friendly way to track tasks.

commitResults.messageTitle: Display stored tasks using list command
commitResults.messageBody:
Add functionality to display all tasks stored into the array when the user enters "list" command.

Each task is shown in the order it was added, giving the user a clear overview of their tasks.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Task class for task list
commitResults.messageBody:
Introduce a Task class to encapsulate task data and behavior.

Each task has a name and a completion status, with methods to mark the task as done or not done. A toString() method is also provided to display the task with its status icon.

This improves code organization and makes it easier to extend task functionality in the future.
Document the toString() method in the Task class with Javadoc

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor task storage from String to Task object
commitResults.messageBody:
Update the program to store tasks as Task objects instead of String.

This allows each task to maintain a name and completion status. The change improves data encapsulation and prepares the code for future extensions.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add task completion with error handling
commitResults.messageBody:
Allow user to mark tasks as completed using the "mark <task number" command.

The program would validate the task number and update the task completion status if it exists. If the number entered is invalid or out of range, an error message would be displayed to guide the user.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor task status method to mark and unmark
commitResults.messageBody:
Rename and refactor the previous markTask() method to a more descriptive name and support marking task as done and reverting them back to not done.

Users can now enter "mark <task number>" to complete a task or "unmark <task number>" to revert back the task completion. Inputs are also validated and error messages are displayed for invalid or out of range task numbers or incorrect commands.

This helps to improve code readability and consolidates status handling.

commitResults.messageTitle: Ui class: Refactor showAddTask() to use Task
commitResults.messageBody:
The method previously accepted a String when displaying newly added task, which limited the ability to display richer task information and made the code harder to extend.

Refactor showAddTask() to accept a Task object and current task count instead.

 This provides clearer feedback by displaying the task details and the total number of task stored, while improving readability and extensibility.

Introduce a ToDo class to encapsulate individual task data and behavior. This prepares the code for a cleaner task management system and improves encapsulation, making tasks easier to extend in the future.

commitResults.messageTitle: Split CommandHandler into TaskManager and Parser
commitResults.messageBody:
CommandHandler was handling multiple responsibilities:
* Task storage, status update and task counting
* Parsing user commands
* Coordinating the program workflow

This violates the Single Responsibility Principle and made the code harder to read, maintain and extend.

Refactor responsibilities into separate classes:
* TaskManager handles all task-related operations
* Parser handles user command parsing

This improves readability and make future extensions and testing easier.

Introduce a Deadline class to allow user to create task with a specific date and time that they must complete. For example: "submit report by 15/01/2026 5pm".

This allows users to see time-sensitive tasks more clearly.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Event class with start and end time
commitResults.messageBody:
Introduce an Event class to allow user to create task that have both a start and end date/time. For example: "project meeting Mon 2-4pm".

This allows users to track scheduled events clearly and differentiate them from todo or deadline tasks.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix error message to reference Event
commitResults.messageBody: Update the exception message in parseEvent() to correctly reference "Event" instead of "Deadline". This ensures that the error message accurately reflects the type of task being parsed, improving clarity to user when input is invalid

Introduce a semi-automated testing of the chatbot using I/O redirection. This technique allows testing of user commands through the use of scripting, reducing the need for manual testing.

Input script and expected output can be found in the text-ui-test folder.
Correct the handleCommand() check for "mark" command. Previously, an unnecessary space caused the command to not be recognized properly.

Introduce three main exception classes for Sora:
* SoraException: abstract base class for all runtime error encountered by Sora
* InvalidFormatException: handles invalid command format
* UnknownCommandException: handles unrecognized commands

These exceptions centralize error handling and makes it easier to manage runtime errors consistently across the application

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor CommandHandler and Parser to use exceptions
commitResults.messageBody: Refactor CommandHandler and Parser to throw custom Sora exceptions instead of generic exceptions to improve error handling consistency and makes the code easier to maintain and extend.

Use an ArrayList to store task instead of fixed-size array to allow dynamic resizing.

This helps to improve code flexibility, removes the fixed-size limit, making it easier to maintain and update the tasks list

commitResults.messageTitle: Ui class: Remove unused echo() method
commitResults.messageBody:
The echo() method in Ui class is no longer used.

Removing it reduces dead code and simplifies the Ui class to improve readability.

Refactor CommandHandler and related classes to make it more scalable and allows future commands tto be integrated with minimal changes.

Rename Parser to CommandParser to better reflect its role in the current structure, improving readability and maintainability.

Introduce a delete function to allow user to remove the task from the task list by specifying the task number.

This helps to allow user to better manage and update their task list, by removing completed or unwanted task.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update input.txt and EXPECTED.TXT for testing
commitResults.messageBody:
Update the input and expected output files used for automated text UI testing.

These changes ensure that the test correctly reflect the recent updates to the commands available, improving the reliability of the semi-automated test suite.

Introduce a formatted string representation for the tasks to support future persistence.

This prepares the code for saving tasks to a file without implementing file I/O yet.

commitResults.messageTitle: Ui Class: Change showError() to static method
commitResults.messageBody:
Change the showError() method to be static since it does not rely on instance state and can be called without creating an Ui object.

 This allows the error message to be displayed without the need to create an Ui object, reducing unnecessary initialization and simplifying usage.

Update CommandHandler and DeleteCommand to use the new static Ui.showError() method.

This ensures that the error messages are being displayed correctly without the need to instantiate an Ui object.
Refactor the code and prepare the groundwork for the storage implementation. This will make it easier to integrate the saving/loading of tasks without disrupting current logic.

commitResults.messageTitle: Storage class: save() to auto-save task
commitResults.messageBody: Implement automatic saving of tasks to the hard disk whenever the task list changes. This allows data to be retained across sessions.

commitResults.messageTitle: Storage class: load() to restore tasks
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, the tasks are only being saved to the disk, but there is no mechanism to restore them at startup.

Implement load() method to load tasks automatically from hard disk at startup.

commitResults.messageTitle: Include sample input and expected output files
commitResults.messageBody: Add sample input and expected output files to ensure that the results are more deterministic and consistent across run.

Currently, Sora is unable to process date and time input correctly, which limits the ability to handle tasks with time-sensitive information effectively.

Implementing parsing and recognition of date and time to correctly schedule, display and manage time-based tasks.

Currently, users can parse dates and times but users cannot filter tasks by date. This limits the usefulness of the time-related feature.

Add a command to allow user to filter by date. This allows users to quickly check tasks and events scheduled for that particular day.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update input.txt and EXPECTED.TXT for testing
commitResults.messageBody:
Update the input and expected output files used for automated text UI testing to support the testing of the `on` command, used to filter tasks by dates.

These changes ensure that the test correctly reflect the recent updates to the commands available, improving the reliability of the semi-automated test suite.

Currently, CommandParser class handles both reading raw inputs and interpreting various command-specific details. This mixes the responsibilities between the class.

Refactor CommandParser to only identify command types, while delegating parsing details to its respective parse() methods.

commitResults.messageTitle: Make Task as an abstract class
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, Task is a concrete class and can be instantiated directly, even though it is intended as a base class for the specific task types. This can lead to accidental creation of invalid task types.

Change Task into an abstract class to prevent direct instantiation and enforce correct usage through the subclasses.

Currently, the Storage class is difficult to read and maintain, making debugging and extending storage-related features difficult and error-prone.

Refactor the Storage class helps to improve code clarity, structure and organization, making the logic clear and easy to follow.

Originally, the Java classes has no package declarations, making it difficult to manage imports, organize classes, and create clear abstraction for different component.

Introducing proper packages to group related classes together, improve modularity and make the codebase easier to maintain and extend.

After reorganizing Java classes into its proper packages, runtime.bat and runtime.sh no longer work correctly for the automated SUT due to the change in class path and imports.

Update the scripts to account for new package structure, ensuring that the automated SUT runs correctly.

This project does not have an automated build
system and relies on manual compilation and
execution.

Manual builds are prone to errors and makes it
harder to run the project consistently across
environment.

Let's
* merge the add-gradle-support branch into master
* configure Gradle to build and run Sora
  application

commitResults.messageTitle: Test: Add JUnit test for Task class
commitResults.messageBody:
Task class lacks automated tests, making it
harder to ensure correct behavior after changes
made.

Without proper tests, future refactoring or
addition of new features may introduce unnoticed
bugs.

Let's
* add JUnit test class for Task
* cover core methods and check input validation

commitResults.messageTitle: Test: Add JUnit test for CommandParser class
commitResults.messageBody:
CommandParser class lacks automated tests,
making it harder to verify correct parsing of user commands and detect regressions.

Without proper tests, changes to parser logic
could unintentionally and affect the application
behavior.

Let's
* add JUnit test class for CommandParser
* covering parsing of valid commands and invalid
inputs

Several classes and methods have Javadoc
comments that are inconsistent or
incomplete, making it hard for developers
to understand and use the code.

Inconsistent Javadoc can lead to
misunderstanding about the method usage
and expected behavior.

Let's
* revise existing Javadoc to follow SE convention
* ensure all public classes and methods have clear descriptions

commitResults.messageTitle: Add find command to search task
commitResults.messageBody:
The application can only filter the task
by date using the on command, making it
difficult for user to locate a specific
task.

This make finding a specific task to be
inefficient and prone to errors,
especially to large task list.

Let's
* implement the find command to filter
task by keyword.
* update parser and command handling to
support this new keyword.

follow SE coding conventions.

Non-compliant import reduces readability and
consistency, and may cause confusion about
which dependencies are being used in tests.

Let's
* reorder import according to SE standard
conventions

Storage class contains a constructor that
accepts a user-provided path but is never used
anywhere in the project.

Unused constructors add unnecessary code,
increase maintenance overhead and may confuse
developers about supported usage.

Let's
* delete the Storage constructor that accepts a
 path from the user
 * ensure all other constructors and methods
 remain functional

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Checkstyle to enforce coding standards
commitResults.messageBody:
The project does not have an automated way to
check code style consistency against coding
convention.

Without automated checks, the style issues can
slip into the codebase and reduce readability
and maintainability over time.

Let's
* add Checkstyle configurations to the project
* integrates Checkstyle into the build process
* enable style checks for main and test source
code

conventions.

Inconsistent conventions reduces readability
and make the parsing logic harder to
understand and maintain

commitResults.messageTitle: CommandParser: Replace if statement with switch
commitResults.messageBody:
CommandParser currently uses multiple if
statements to handle different command types in
parseIndexCommand() which reduces readability
and increases complexity as the number of
commands grows.

Using a switch statement simplifies the logic,
making it easier to understand and maintain.

Let's
* replace if-else chains with a switch
statement for command parsing
* ensure all existing command are correctly
handled

commitResults.messageTitle: Storage: Replace if statement with switch
commitResults.messageBody:
Storage currently uses multiple if statements
to handle different task types in
loadTask() which reduces readability and
increases complexity as the number of
tasks grows.

Using a switch statement simplifies the logic,
making it easier to understand and maintain.

Let's
* replace if-else chains with a switch
statement for task parsing
* ensure all existing tasks are correctly
handled

The project currently does not have a
graphical user interface, making user
interaction limited to the command line.

Adding a GUI improves usability and
provides a more interactive experience
for user.

Let's
* create a Launcher class to start the
application
* set up a basic Main class with minimal
stage and scene
* print "Hello World" to verify
successful GUI launch

Set up the GUI for Sora, including the
main layout, controls, and a custom
Dialogbox for chat messages.

Previously, Sora only has a command-line
interface, limiting user interaction and
experience.

Let's
* create Main.java with a basic
AnchorPane layout
* implement DialogBox custom control
with ImageView and Label
* set window properties and control
sizing to match the mockup
* style DialogBox to wrap text and scale
images appropriately.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add user interaction in JavaFx GUI
commitResults.messageBody:
Sora GUI currently only display static dialog
boxes and does not respond to user input,
limiting interactivity and usability.

Let's
* add event handlers for user input via Enter
key and send button
* implement handleUserInput() to display user
messages and Sora response
* create Sora#getResponse() to echo input
* update DialogBox with flip method and static
factory methods
* attach listener to dialogContainer height to
auto-scroll ScrollPane

commitResults.messageTitle: Add output handling for console and GUI
commitResults.messageBody:
Sora chatbot outputs responses only to the
console. There is no structured way to handle
output for multiple interface, limiting the
future GUI integration and flexibility.

Let's
* create OutputHandler interface to define
output behavior
* implement ConsoleOutput for standard console
printing
* implement GuiOutput to support GUI-based
output
* prepare code structure for routing responses
to the appropriate output interface

The Ui class currently outputs the response to
the console, making it inflexible for
supporting multiple interfaces such as the GUI.

Let's
* integrate OutputHandler interface into Ui
* delegate output tasks to the assigned
OutputHandler instance
* ensure console output still works via
ConsoleOutput
* prepare for future GUI output using GuiOutput

OnCommand currently sends error output
directly to the console, which  prevents
responses from being displayed in the GUI.

Let's
* replace Ui.showError() with ui.showError() to delegate all output to the provided OutputHandler

DeleteCommand currently sends error output
directly to the console, which  prevents
responses from being displayed in the GUI.

Let's
* replace Ui.showError() with ui.showError() to delegate all output to the provided OutputHandler

commitResults.messageTitle: Update CommandHandler to support GUI input
commitResults.messageBody:
CommandHandler currently only processes input
from the console, which prevents the GUI input
from being handled correctly.

Let's
* modify CommandHandler to accept input from
GUI components
* integrates with OutputHandler to display
responses in the GUI
* ensure console input processing remains
functional
* prepare the codebase for seamless console
and GUI integration

commitResults.messageTitle: Update Storage to support GUI input and output
commitResults.messageBody:
Storage currently only saves and retrieves
tasks based on console interactions. GUI input
and output are not persistent, limiting the
usability when interacting through the GUI.

Let's
* modify Storage to accept input and output
from GUI components
* ensure tasks entered via GUI are saved or
deleted accordingly

TaskManager currently only communicates task
updates through console, which prevents
changes from being reflected in the GUI.

Let's
* integrate TaskManager with OutputHandler to
send updates to GUI
* ensures all task additions, deletions, and
modifications trigger appropriate output

Let's
* modify Storage to accept input and output
from GUI components
* ensure tasks entered via GUI are saved or
deleted accordingly

commitResults.messageTitle: Update Sora class to support GUI input/output
commitResults.messageBody:
Sora previously only handled console inputs
and echoed responses directly, preventing
integration with GUI components and
OutputHandler.

Let's
* add a constructor accepting an OutputHandler
for GUI output
* refactor processInput() to delegate input to
CommandHandler
* maintain default constructor for CLI usage

commitResults.messageTitle: Update Main to integrate GUI input/output
commitResults.messageBody:
Main previously only display user input
locally and display both user and Sora
responses directly within the GUI, without
leveraging Sora's output handling system.

Let's
* initialise Sora with a GuiOutput instance to handle GUI response
* delegate user input to Sora for processing instead of echoing directly
* maintain user dialog display and handle ExitCommand to exit application gracefully

CommandHandler previously contained
endProgram() to check if the program has
ended. The method is no longer called
anywhere, leading to unnecessary clutter and
potential confusion for future maintenance.

Let's
* delete endProgram() from the class
* ensure that all existing functionality
remains intact

Main class previously handled both GUI layout
and controller logic, making it difficult to
maintain and update the UI. All components,
listeners, and utility methods were defined in
code, increasing complexity for visual tweaks.

Let's
* create MainWindow.fxml and MainWindow.java
as the main GUI controller
* create DialogBox.fxml and DialogBox.java to
use FXMLLoader
* trim Main.java to only load the FXML, inject
the Sora instance and show the stage
* use @FXML annotations to bind UI elements to
controller methods and variables

commitResults.messageTitle: CommandParser: Refactor conditional logic to use switch-case
commitResults.messageBody:
CommandParser previously relied on chained
if-else statements to determine which command
should be parsed. This approach reduce
readability and made the logic harder to
maintain as more commands were added.

Using a switch expression improves clarity and
structure by centralising keyword matching in
a single, readable construct. It also
leverages modern Java features, making the
parsing logic more concise and less
error-prone.

Let's
* replace if-else branching with switch
expression
* improve readability and maintainability of
parsing logic
* preserve existing command behaviour

The previous class named UnmarkedCommand does
not comply with the project's coding standard
convention. Using past-tense verbs can cause
inconsistency and reduce readability.

Let's
* rename UnmarkedCommand to UnmarkCommand
* update all references to the new class name
* ensure all existing functionality remains
intact

The field iconAdded was renamed to isIconAdded
to comply with the naming convention stated
for boolean variables, which typically use
'is' or 'has' prefixes.

This improves code readability and makes it
clearer that the field represents a boolean
state.

Let's
* rename iconAdded to isIconAdded
* update all references in code to use the new
name
* maintain existing functionality without
changes

Sora responses was being truncated when the
output was too long, causing messages to be
cut off and not fully displayed in the GUI.
This prevented users from viewing the complete
response.

This change sets
`msg.setMaxWidth(Double.MAX_VALUE)` to allow
the message label to expand fully and display
all text without truncation.

Let's
* allow labels to use maximum available width
* maintain proper text wrapping in dialog boxes
* ensure scroll behavior remains smooth
